title: 'As it ceases to inspire, the US is losing part of itself'
subhead: Donald Trump's second term has turned the United States into a threat to which the rest of the world has no choice but to adapt. Yet, over the past eight decades, habits and practices have taken root that will be used to counter this new imperialism, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: Trump demands talks to acquire Greenland but 'won't use force'
EU Parliament refers Mercosur trade deal to bloc's top court
Lactalis recalls baby formula in several countries over toxin
subhead: The French dairy multinational said Wednesday the recalls concerned batches in France, China, Australia and Mexico and stressed that authorities had not reported any case of consumption of the affected products.

title: French gender equality council warns of threat posed by masculinist networks
subhead: The High Council for Equality between Women and Men, which advises public authorities on gender equality, published a report on Wednesday that distinguishes between 'paternalistic' and 'hostile' sexism.

title: 'The Wizard of the Kremlin': An epic tale of power through the eyes of a man in the shadows
subhead: Director Olivier Assayas seeks to shed light on how Russia came to fall under the grip of Vladimir Putin, played by Jude Law.

title: Maya Kandel, historian: 'The more Trump uses force, the more confident he becomes'
subhead: Elected on an isolationist promise, the American president has multiplied foreign interventions. This policy risks weakening his MAGA base, the researcher says in an interview with Le Monde.

title: Marine Le Pen insists party acted in 'good faith' at appeal trial
Ubisoft unveils details of big restructuring bet
Trump's desire to avoid military force over Greenland a 'positive' sign, Denmark says
Amid crisis, Denmark and Greenland favor shared diplomacy

Davos takes stock of a transatlantic alliance trampled by Trump
Syria's government gives Kurds more time to reach an agreement
New documentary offers rare look inside Macron's diplomatic team
French journalist jailed in Turkey is released
French government has 'no desire' for World Cup boycott 'as it stands'
Claude Le Roy: 'The Senegalese players were overwhelmed by emotion and completely lost control'
Why Morocco's king accepted to join Trump's 'Board of Peace'
In the Ukrainian Carpathians, peace feels both near and far
subhead: In Uzhhorod, a border city near Slovakia, exhausted and disillusioned residents have long stopped believing in victory and expect little from ongoing diplomatic talks. They only hope that the war will end, even 'if it means sacrificing a piece of the country to be saved.'

title: Affordability has become a dominant political issue in the US
subhead: After months of dismissing rising prices as a 'Democratic scam,' Donald Trump is now making a series of announcements aimed at making, as the midterm elections approach.

title: In one year, Trump has imposed a culture of impunity
subhead: Since returning to the White House, the American president has exempted himself from all rules, both domestically and internationally. This sense of impunity now permeates his entire administration.

title: A 'Board of Peace,' to do what?
The necessary showdown with Donald Trump
Jean Pisani-Ferry, economist: 'Is AI fueling a new wave of growth or a bubble?'
